The National Union for Democracy and Progress  (, UNDP) is a political party in the Central African Republic led by Michel Amine.
History
The UNDP was launched in 2014, and officially recognised on 17 July. It did not nominate a presidential candidate in the 2015â€“16 general elections, but it emerged as the joint-largest party in the National Assembly, winning 13 of the 131 seats.
